entry.et: Middle English ariven, from Anglo-French ariver, from Vulgar Latin *arripare to come to shore, from Latin ad- + ripa shore rive

def.dt: :to make an appearance the guests have arrived
:to be near in time :come the moment has arrived
:to reach by effort or thought arrived at a decision

entry.et: French, from past participle of arriver to arrive, from Old French ariver

def.dt: :one who has risen rapidly to success, power, or fame
